news.title: India's office space stock crosses 1 billion sq ft in Q3 2025: Report
news.para: India's office market saw a 24% year-on-year surge in gross leasing to 66.7 million sq ft in the first nine months of 2025. Bengaluru led leasing activity, while Global Capability Centres and IT services drove demand. Rents rose across major markets, and vacancy levels declined as India's office stock surpassed 1 billion sq ft.

news.title: Karnataka HC overturns order on approving firm’s modified building plan
news.para: A division bench of the Karnataka High Court has overturned a single-judge order that compelled the BBMP to approve a modified building plan for Sangam Enterprises. The court ruled that the modified plan, which sought significant setback relaxation using a TDR certificate, did not comply with rules notified after the application was submitted.

news.title: Bombay HC orders builder to pay daily penalty for failing to secure fire NOC
news.para: Bombay High Court mandates a daily Rs 50,000 penalty for builders failing to secure Fire NOC for Kandivali West flats by December 31, 2025.  This stern ruling follows a decade-long delay, impacting flat owners' ability to occupy their homes due to missing essential safety certificates and occupation permits.

news.title: Two Pune civic body's officials suspended for overlooking illegal construction
news.para: In a decisive move to uphold building regulations, the Pune Municipal Corporation has put a halt to the employment of two officials from their TDR department. These individuals have been implicated in failing to prevent the unauthorized construction of additional floors on a property, with work already progressing to the seventh floor.

news.title: Austrian: Rene Benko appeals against insolvency fraud conviction
news.para: Austrian property tycoon Rene Benko is appealing his two-year jail sentence for insolvency fraud. A court convicted him for moving money to his mother before his company Signa collapsed. Prosecutors are also appealing his acquittal on a separate charge. The Signa bankruptcy is Austria's largest since World War Two. Investigations into further alleged crimes continue.

news.title: Charity commissioner orders 'status quo' in sale of  Jain trust's property to Pune builder
news.para: In a significant move, Pune's Charity Commissioner Amogh Kaloti has intervened to stop the impending sale of a valuable property that accommodates a Jain boarding facility and temple. The property, spanning 12,000 square meters, was poised to be sold to a private developer for Rs 311 crore.

news.title: Holcim to buy walling specialist Xella for 1.85 billion euros
news.para: Holcim is set to make more major acquisitions in the coming months. The company recently bought German firm Xella for 1.85 billion euros. This move aims to tap into Europe's growing refurbishment market. Holcim is focusing more on sustainable building products. The acquisition is expected to boost earnings in the first year.

news.title: WeWork India clarifies on InGovern's IPO report over compliance
news.para: WeWork India addressed multiple governance concerns raised by InGovern, clarifying issues on IPO structure, profitability route, promoter litigation, lease accounting, related-party transactions, and brand licensing. The company affirmed compliance with SEBI norms and maintained strong operational performance and transparency.

news.title: Punjab government gears up to redraw Mohali civic body's limits
news.para: Mohali's municipal boundaries are set for a significant expansion, with a formal notification expected in early November. This move will incorporate rapidly developing areas like Aerocity and IT City, nearly doubling the existing wards. The expansion aims to provide essential civic amenities and integrate these areas into the city's planned development framework.

news.title: Bengaluru: BDA's empty promises deepen KG Layout residents' despair
news.para: Despite repeated visits, assurances, KG Layout residents still endure slushy roads, poor drainage, missing infrastructure across long-delayed housing project. The long-standing issue of poor infrastructure in the layout has once again come to light after heavy rain turned several stretches into slushy, unmotorable zones.

news.title: CapitaLand Investment India to invest upto ₹1,300 crore to develop 2.6 million sq ft in FY26
news.para: CapitaLand Investment India is exploring InvIT structures for its logistics and data centre platforms while keeping its office assets within the existing Singapore-listed CapitaLand vehicle. The company sees a strong FY25 demand backdrop and is strategically recycling capital by divesting older assets to reinvest in newer supply and redevelopment projects.

news.title: Building plans must follow norms during approval stage: Karnataka HC
news.para: The law cannot remain static to the detriment of public interest. Urban planning must reflect the current policy & regulatory framework

news.title: Betterment tax, stamp cess to be levied around Bengaluru Business Corridor to recover costs
news.para: The Karnataka government will impose a betterment tax and a 1% stamp duty cess on properties near the Bengaluru Business Corridor (BBC) to recover project costs. These measures, along with transit-oriented development, aim to help the Bangalore Development Authority repay a Rs 27,000-crore loan from HUDCO.

news.title: No OC but shop leased out to bank, Bombay HC slaps ₹50 lakh on owner
news.para: Bombay HC fined a businessman Rs 50 lakh for leasing a shop in a redeveloped building lacking an occupation certificate (OC) to a bank. The court emphasized the businessman's obligation to ensure lawful occupation, even when subletting. The bank's officers were also directed to investigate lapses leading to the unlawful operation.

news.title: Brookfield makes ₹5,000 crore bid for India logistics push
news.para: Brookfield is making a strategic leap into the Indian logistics market by acquiring a substantial portfolio that spans 13 mn square feet, sourced from a partnership between ESR and Allianz, alongside additional standout ESR assets. This strategic acquisition signals Brookfield's commitment to tapping into India's growing logistics and warehousing market, reflecting a robust institutional interest in the industry.

news.title: China's new home prices fall at fastest pace in 11 months in September 2025
news.para: China's real estate landscape is grappling with an unprecedented slump, the worst it has seen in over ten years. September revealed a sharp decline in new home prices, shaking consumer confidence and stalling economic momentum. Developer defaults have compounded the issue, raising red flags for officials aiming to restore stability.

news.title: Infopark’s Irumpanam campus would be mixed township model: Kerala CM
news.para: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan announced that Infopark's upcoming Phase IV campus in Irumpanam will be a mixed township model, featuring five million square feet of new IT space. This development is expected to create 50,000 direct IT jobs and attract Rs 3,000 crore in direct investments, bolstering Kochi's industrial prominence.

news.title: Developers to act as urban infrastructure administrators in major city overhauls under UCF
news.para: The government is launching the Urban Challenge Fund (UCF) with a Rs 1 lakh crore outlay, allowing private developers to act as "urban infrastructure administrators" in redevelopment zones. This initiative aims to improve civic infrastructure by enabling private entities to develop and maintain essential services like roads and water supply, with financial support from the Centre, bonds, loans, and states.

news.title: Owners in a fix as Secunderabad cantonment board hikes property tax by over 100%
news.para: Secunderabad Cantonment Board property owners face a property tax increase exceeding 100%, a hike residents deem unprecedented. This comes amid fears of property loss due to a proposed road widening project, exacerbating financial anxieties for owners and tenants.

news.title: Orissa HC directs arrest of promoters for violating CRZ norms in Puri
news.para: In a significant move to protect the environment, the Orissa High Court has ordered the arrest of promoters for a major project in Puri. The court acted after the promoters allegedly violated coastal regulatory zone norms and continued construction despite submitting an undertaking to halt all activity.
